bug.short_desc: zoom in and out messages in french are permuted

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
I am using the french version of Firefox 4. and put customize the toolbar with the "- +" icon visible in my toolbar. when I passed on top of the "+" icon I got the "zoom arrière" message and for the icon "-" the "zoom avant" one. the normal messages are the opposite : + = avant and - = arrière
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1.customize the toolbar 2.include the - + option in the toolbar 3.put the mouse on top of the - or + icons Actual Results: when I passed on top of the "+" icon I got the "zoom arrière" message and for the icon "-" the "zoom avant" one.
Expected Results: the normal messages are the opposite : + = avant and - = arrière

Confirmed on Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.2a1pre) Gecko/20110407 Firefox/4.2a1pre
Hovering on "+" icon displays the message as "Zoom arrière" and hovering on "-" icons displays the message as "Zoom avant"

Thanks for reporting. This is now fixed:
http://hg.mozilla.org/l10n-central/fr/rev/7bee93717729 http://hg.mozilla.org/releases/l10n-mozilla-2.0/fr/rev/054e0d79a99e
The fix will appear in the next nigthlies and Firefox 4.0.1.
